headline: French radical far-right groups call for 'sacred union' after activist's death
description: The march planned for Quentin Deranque this Saturday in Lyon could be an opportunity for ultra-right groups to unite around the far-right activist, who has been elevated to the status of political martyr. But far-right leading figure Jordan Bardella ordered his party's elected officials not to attend.

headline: Former Prince Andrew arrested for several hours by police in historic event for the UK
With 'American Obituary,' U2 returns to the battle, taking aim at Trump
Bovine skin disease: After eight months of tension, French health crisis appears to be ending
description: With no new cases of this disease identified since January 2 and two million cattle vaccinated, the last regulated zone still in place is expected to be lifted on Friday.

headline: Berlinale: Mahnaz Mohammadi unveils psychological thriller 'Roya,' inspired by her time in prison in Iran
description: The drama, led by Turkish actress Melisa Sözen, immerses viewers in the nightmare of imprisonment through sound, distorted visuals, and the heroine's disoriented perspective.

headline: Pro-Palestinian activism on trial in Belgium
description: The Belgian subsidiary of an Israeli arms company, which manufactures fire control systems, among other things, is seeking €65,000 in damages from seven pro-Palestinian activists who took part in an occupation of its headquarters.

headline: 'For the British monarchy, the stakes of the Epstein files go far beyond the individual case of a compromised prince'
description: The involvement of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor in the Epstein affair reveals the porous boundaries between public service, private interests and familial loyalties, writes historian Catherine Marshall.

headline: Paris mayoral election campaign gets bogged down in controversy
Ukraine Paralympics team to boycott opening ceremony over Russian flag decision
Appeals trial for murder of Samuel Paty: Abdelhakim Sefrioui believes everyone is to blame, except himself
Venezuelan parliament unanimously passes amnesty law
Real or faux, vintage or new, fur is no longer hiding
In Dhaka, Sheikh Hasani's palace has been turned into a museum honoring victims of the July 2024 uprising
USA beat Canada 2-1 to win Olympic women's ice hockey gold medal
Italy, the UK and Japan hope to bring Germany on board their next-generation fighter jet project
Eric Dane, 'Grey's Anatomy' star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
'Lawless zones around Israel are the result of the Pax Judaica made possible by uncontested military hegemony'
Tom Fletcher: 'Anyone who says the UN is dead should spend some time with my colleagues in Sudan or DRC'
Trump says he's ordering release of data on UFOs and aliens
Gaza's local authorities massively underreported deaths, says international research team
description: The first independent field study on Gaza to not involve local authorities, published in The Lancet Global Health on Wednesday, concludes that the number of violent deaths linked to the conflict has been underreported by about 35%.

headline: France's 13,335 millionaires who pay no income tax
description: In 2024, thousands of taxpayers with significant real estate wealth paid no income tax, according to a previously unpublished note from the Finance Ministry. These revelations have reignited the debate over taxing the country's wealthiest.

headline: Xavier Dolan, filmmaker: "Where does the idea that artists should 'stay out of politics' come from?"
description: A controversy is stirring at this year's Berlinale. At their opening press conference, the jury members declined to comment on the situation in Palestine, with their president, Wim Wenders, arguing that cinema should 'stay out of politics.' Canadian director Xavier Dolan responds to him in an op-ed for Le Monde.

headline: Patrick Artus: 'The unpopular reforms France nevertheless needs to undertake'
'The French economy is paradoxically experiencing a renewed sense of optimism'
'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
